job_stories.title: Submit Code for Review
job_stories.situation: I have written code that I want to check for issues
job_stories.outcome: I can find and fix problems before committing

acceptance_criteria.given: I am on the Code Review page
acceptance_criteria.when: I paste JavaScript or TypeScript code into the editor
acceptance_criteria.then: The editor displays syntax highlighting for the detected language

acceptance_criteria.given: I have pasted code into the editor
acceptance_criteria.then: A loading spinner appears with 'Analyzing...' message

acceptance_criteria.given: The AI is analyzing my code
acceptance_criteria.then: The suggestions panel displays the results grouped by category
An error message is shown with a 'Retry' button

job_stories.title: Review and Understand Suggestions
job_stories.situation: the AI has analyzed my code and found issues
job_stories.motivation: understand what problems exist and why they matter
job_stories.outcome: I can learn and decide which issues to fix

acceptance_criteria.given: Suggestions are displayed in the panel
acceptance_criteria.then: Each suggestion shows a severity badge (Critical/Warning/Info) with appropriate color

acceptance_criteria.given: I see a suggestion in the list
acceptance_criteria.when: I click on the suggestion card
acceptance_criteria.then: The card expands to show the full AI explanation
The editor scrolls to and highlights the relevant line of code

acceptance_criteria.when: I click a category tab (Security, Bugs, Performance, Style)
acceptance_criteria.then: The list filters to show only suggestions in that category

acceptance_criteria.given: The AI found no issues in my code
acceptance_criteria.then: A celebration empty state is shown saying 'No issues found!'

job_stories.title: Apply Suggested Fix
job_stories.situation: I see a suggestion that has an auto-fix available
job_stories.motivation: quickly apply the fix without manual editing

acceptance_criteria.given: A suggestion has an available auto-fix
acceptance_criteria.when: I view the expanded suggestion card

acceptance_criteria.then: I see a side-by-side comparison with red for removed code and green for added code

acceptance_criteria.given: I am viewing the diff preview
acceptance_criteria.then: The code in the editor updates with the fix applied
The suggestion card shows a green checkmark indicating 'Resolved'
An 'Undo' button is visible that can revert the change
